newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bourse chief hails gov't YPF sale.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bourse chief hails gov't YPF sale.

text.p: Buenos Aires Stock Exchange chief Julio Macchi Friday welcomed the government's decision to sell more shares in oil giant YPF SA.

"The sale of the YPF shares is positive and the market is receiving that news well," Macchi told local radio. But he added "As there is a negative tendency in the market the measure did not have the impact it would have had a month ago."
Economy Minister Roque Fernandez told Congress Thursday the government hoped to raise $1.0 billion this year from privatizations, including the sale of shares in YPF, which it privatized in 1993.
The government still holds a 20.5-percent stake in YPF.
